Class Player

java.lang.Object
  Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
AI
public class Player
extends java.lang.Object

This class creates a Player who will play this Monopoly game.

Version:
May 23, 2015
Author:
William Wang, Aditya Kotak, Rahul Sarathy., Period: 6, Assignment: MonopolyGame, Sources: none

move

public ListNode2<Space> move(int numOfSpaces)
This method moves this player on the gameboard based on a certain number of steps. If the player passes go, this player will be paid $200.

Parameters:
numOfSpaces - the integer value for the number of spaces this player needs to be moved on the gameboard
Returns:
currSpace the space where this player landed after moving numOfSpaces

mortgage

public boolean mortgage(Player p,
                        java.util.ArrayList<PropertySpace> properties,
                        java.util.ArrayList<RailroadSpace> railroads,
                        java.util.ArrayList<UtilitySpace> utilities)
This method will sell hotels, then houses, then utilities, then railroads, and then properties until this player has non negative money.

Parameters:
p - the Player who will have it's assets sold.
properties - the properties of this player
railroads - the railroads of this player
utilities - the utilities of this player
Returns:
true if selling the assets has brought the player to positive amount of money, false if not.

allPropsInGroupHave4Houses

public boolean allPropsInGroupHave4Houses(PropertySpace propertySpace)
This method checks that if all properties in a specified property group has four houses

Parameters:
propertySpace - the propertyspace that will be used for the property group
Returns:
true if all properties in the specified group have 4 houses.

buyHouse

public void buyHouse()
This method will buy ask the user if he or she wants to buy a house on a specified property. Allows the user to quit buying a house if he or she types in "quit." This method will check if the player is allowed to buy a house on the property. If he or she is allowed to do so, this method will prompt the user to choose the number of houses to be added. If the number will cause the total number to exceed 4 or if the number itself is 0 or less, this method will prompt the user to try again.

buyHotel

public void buyHotel()
This method buys a hotel for this player on a given property that this player can choose. This method checks whether or not a hotel can be built on the property based on whether the entire group has 4 houses on each and also allows the user to quit buying a hotel if he or she chooses.

typeInt

public int typeInt(PropertySpace s)
This method is used in buyHouse where the user must type in an integer for the number of houses he or she would like to buy. It uses a try catch exception to ensure any input is only an integer of the word "quit" which will be used to quit buying a house.

Returns:
an integer
